meanings.definition: To calculate the caloric content of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to calorize this recipe to know how many calories it has.
meanings.sent2: She likes to calorize her meals to keep track of her daily intake.
meanings.sent3: I tried to calorize the cake, but it seems to have more calories than I expected.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to calorize the food on the plate, estimating its caloric value.
meanings.sent5: The nutritionist taught me how to calorize different foods accurately.

meanings.sent1: Can you calorize the amount of sugar in this drink for me?
meanings.sent2: The app can calorize the ingredients of any dish you input.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally calorized the wrong ingredient, making the calculation incorrect.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to calorize every food item she saw into its caloric equivalent.
meanings.sent5: The machine can calorize any food sample accurately within seconds.

meanings.definition: To measure the energy content of food.
meanings.sent1: We need to calorize the snacks before packing them for the hike.
meanings.sent2: The scientist will calorize the new protein bar to determine its nutritional value.
meanings.sent3: I tried to calorize the energy in the banana, but it kept slipping from my mind.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for nutrition made her naturally calorize every meal she encountered.
meanings.sent5: The device can calorize the energy levels of various foods with great accuracy.
